title: Ukraine Buoyed by Hero’s Welcome for Zelensky in Washington
description: Ukrainians, many left in the dark and cold by Russian airstrikes, drew solace from President Volodymyr Zelensky’s speech to Congress.

title: Zelensky’s Weapons Wish List Goes Mostly Unfulfilled on Trip to Washington
description: The Biden administration continues to balk at sending U.S. battle tanks, fighter jets and long-range missiles to Ukraine.

title: White House Says North Korea Is Delivering Arms to Russia’s Wagner Group
description: The paramilitary group has played a central role in Russia’s efforts to storm the city of Bakhmut in Donetsk Province, which borders Luhansk.

title: Juan Guaidó, the Face of Opposition in Venezuela, May Be Voted Out
description: The lawmaker may soon be voted out of power by the opposition, which no longer sees his interim government as a path to “real political change” against the country’s authoritarian regime.

title: Your Friday Briefing: A Times Investigation Into Bucha
description: Also, Benjamin Netanyahu is poised to lead Israel again and the week in culture.

title: Israel’s New Government Pushes A Rush of Far-Right Initiatives
description: Benjamin Netanyahu needed the support of far-right factions to return to the prime minister’s office. Now they want to curb the powers of the judiciary, giving rise to fears about an erosion of democracy.

title: The Ukrainian leader sought to convey the reality of the war to Washington.
Xi Xi, Whose Writing Defined a Changing Hong Kong, Dies at 85
description: Her work captured the unease of Hong Kong’s transition to Chinese rule, gave voice to the city’s children and working-class residents, and helped put it on the literary map.

title: At France’s Oldest Christmas Market, Energy Crisis Dims Festive Spirits
description: Amid soaring gas prices and the war in Ukraine, Strasbourg’s Christkindelsmärik, like holiday fairs across Europe, has faced a tough question: “How do you balance magic and responsibility?”

title: Germany Arrests a Suspected Russian Spy Inside Its Intelligence Agency
description: The suspect, a German citizen, is being charged with treason. He is accused of passing state secrets to Moscow.

title: Oscar White Muscarella, Museum ‘Voice of Conscience,’ Dies at 91
description: An archaeologist at the Met, he warned about plundered and fake antiquities and about the acquisition practices of collectors and museums, including his own.

title: Lukashenko Speaks on Belarus’s Military Moves and Ukraine War
description: Some Ukrainian officials have warned that a military exercise involving Russia could be a precursor to a new offensive aimed at Kyiv.

title: Waiter Shortage Hits London Restaurants After Brexit
description: Europeans used to flock to London for restaurant jobs. Now, with doors to migrants largely closed after Britain left the European Union, many establishments are becoming desperate.

title: Ukraine’s Zelensky Brings His Olive Green Sweatshirt to Congress
description: Volodymyr Zelensky came to Washington wearing his reality on his sleeves.

title: In Bakhmut, a Food Stand Stays Open Despite the War
description: Despite all the shelling, and with no electricity, one snack shop is still serving the soldiers and citizens who have stayed in Bakhmut, Ukraine, a pivotal battleground in the war.

title: Trump Oversight
description: After years of evading congressional investigators, Donald Trump is taking hits.

title: Zelensky Heads Home to Dire Situation After Hero’s Welcome in Washington
description: While the U.S. gave the Ukrainian leader a coveted missile battery, additional aid was tied up by a political squabble in Washington.

title: To Save a Ruin, Send in the Sheep
description: The archaeological park of Pompeii has found a low-tech way to prevent the site from being overrun by vegetation: hungry sheep.

title: For Zelensky, a Celebration of Resilience and a Sales Pitch for Support
description: For all the talk of victory, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s remarks in Washington revealed hints about his worries for the year ahead.

title: What Is the Polar Vortex? And Other Cold-Weather Climate Questions
description: As much of the United States plunges into a deep freeze, scientists continue to debate how rapid Arctic warming is playing a role.

title: Nepalese Court Orders the Release of Charles Sobhraj From Prison
description: The action trims the life sentence Charles Sobhraj, known as ‘the Serpent,’ who targeted Western tourists in Asia in the 1970s and ’80s.

title: Caught on Camera, Traced by Phone: The Russian Military Unit That Killed Dozens in Bucha
description: Exclusive evidence obtained in a monthslong investigation identifies the Russian regiment — and commander — behind one of the worst atrocities in Ukraine.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Volodymyr Zelensky visited President Biden in his first known trip outside Ukraine since Russia invaded.

title: Day 22: A Very Bollywood Christmas
description: Like many families only one generation removed from the “old country,” an Indian American writer’s family puts its own imprint on this omnipresent holiday.

title: Biden and Zelensky Present a United Front Against Russia
description: President Biden and President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine presented a united front against Russian aggression.
